Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
August 24 - 25, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, and Modified,
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an initial treatment plan for each resident within 30
calendar days of admission.
Two of three current resident files reviewed did not have an initial service plan
completed within the required 30 calendar days. One initial treatment plan was
three days late and one initial treatment plan was two days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION Renewal report 08/11/2020; CAP approved 08/14/2020
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an updated treatment plan for each resident at least once
every 90-calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
Two of three current resident files reviewed did not have an updated service plan
completed within the required 90 calendar days. One updated treatment plan was
11 days late and another updated treatment plan was seven days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION Renewal report 08/11/2020; CAP approved 08/14/2020
R 400.4161 Seclusion rooms; policies and procedures.
An institution approved to use a seclusion room shall
establish and follow written policies and procedures
specifying its use. The policy shall include, at a minimum,
all of the following provisions:
(e) Staff shall observe the resident at intervals of 15
minutes or less and shall record the observation in a
seclusion room log. Video surveillance shall not be the only
means of observation.
(iii) Name of staff person responsible for placement.
1

One of eight seclusion room logs did not observe the resident at intervals of 15
minutes or less. The observation time was 2:04pm and 2:30pm, 26 minutes apart.
Two of eight seclusion room logs did not have staff initials next to the observed time
check of the resident.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Policy violation. Please note that there
are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Discussed and provided guidance on how to complete the Chief Administrator
Annual Assessment and Corrective Action Plan.
 Provided clarification that TB test need to be verified every one year after last
verification or prior the expiration of the current verification. Employees will
have yearly TB tests based on the employee’s verification date, rather than
having all employees get a TB test in May/June each year. While at the facility
an excel spreadsheet was developed to track when yearly TB tests for all
employees will need to be completed. The facility will work with the contracted
nursing staff to develop signup sheets for employees so TB tests can be
completed on site.
 While on site an excel spreadsheet was developed to track when an
employee’s driver’s licenses expire. This will help the agency track and ensure
that all employees that transport youth possess a valid driver’s license.
 When youth are in seclusion staff shall observe the youth at intervals of 15
minutes or less. The facility’s seclusion room logs documented some intervals
of 15 minutes but not routinely throughout the seclusion.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Clinical sessions, individual and/or group, should be documented within the
treatment plans or listed in MiSACWIS. This would allow the consultant to see
that clinical sessions have occurred without the facility having to gather other
files.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
During the period under review there have been 11 special investigations. One
special investigation is currently pending. Three investigations resulted in the facility
being found in full compliance. Seven investigations resulted in the facility being
found in non-compliance, requiring corrective action plans. The facility submitted
seven corrective action plans not related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The non-compliances included staff qualifications, agency policies, not completing an
incident report, health care policies and procedures, behavior management, and
physical restraint. During quarterly unannounced visits and corrective action plan
compliance reviews, the agency has successfully implemented all aspects of their
corrective action plans.
Interviews with youth and staff were conducted. Youth reported feeling safe,
receiving treatment, and having their needs met. Staff reported recent administrative
changes and the hiring of more staff as a positive direction for the facility.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on their
regular license.
